title: Restore the Temple
description: You work with several worshippers of the temple's faith, gifted masons, and skilled laborers to restore the temple and once more consecrate it as a sacred place devoted to the worship of their god. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="resource-points" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d6">Lose 1d6 Resource Points</button>, then attempt a DC 25 Folklore check.

criticalSuccess.msg: The temple is restored and can now serve as a Refuge terrain feature. If you later build a settlement here, the temple instead functions as a free Shrine in the settlement. In addition, your work was so excellent that you’ve attracted their god’s attention! The PC who rolled the Folklore check is granted @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.boons-and-curses.Item.hrTl9kfSNrOQeNze]: whenever that PC critically fails a check to Subsist in the wild, they gain a failure instead.

success.msg: The temple is restored and can now serve as a Refuge terrain feature. If you later build a settlement here, the temple instead functions as a free Shrine in the settlement.

failure.msg: Work proceeds but is not yet complete; you can attempt to restore the temple again on the next Kingdom turn.

criticalFailure.msg: Disaster strikes as the temple’s cavern collapses and rubble spills out to bury and destroy much of the temple’s plaza. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="decay" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Gain 1 Decay</button> and <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d4">Gain 1d4 Unrest</button>. You can still attempt to Restore the Temple, but the DC for success increases by 4. This increase is cumulative with successive critical failures.
